oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nanosized metal oxides in the mesopores of MCM-41 and MCM-48 silicates
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: DAPURKAR, SE
BADAMALI, SK
SELVAM, P
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: optical-properties
molecular-sieves

host-guest chemistry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The present work describes the preparation and characterization of nanosized metal oxide particles (Fe2O3, ZnO and PbO) inside the mesopore channels of MCM-41 and MCM-48 silicate molecular sieves. The encapsulation of the metal oxides was carried out at room temperature by the incipient wetness method. Diffuse reflectance ultraviolet-visible spectroscopic studies showed a significant shift in the absorption band for the entrapped metal oxides as compared to the corresponding bulk oxides. Thus, confirming the quantum confinement of the incorporated nanoparticles in MCM-41 and MCM-48. (C) 2001 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Workshop on Nanostructured Materials and Catalysis,PERTH, AUSTRALIA,JUL 09-12, 2000
